decision_conditions:
<p><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;
mso-fareast-font-family:Calibri;mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-ligatures:
standardcontextual;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA">The proposal due to its siting and scale infilling the
gap between the houses and the loss of the garage doors to be replaced with a
window would harm the special character and appearance of this part of the
Tookes Green Conservation Area as one of the first areas of Metroland in the
country. There is not clear and convincing justification for, nor public
benefits to outweigh the harm, contrary to the requirements of the NPPF. The
proposal therefore conflicts with section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings
and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, NPPF paragraphs 201, 203, 205, 206, 208, 209,
212, London Plan policy HC1C, Harrow Core Strategy policy CS1, Development
Management Policies Local Plan policy DM 7, Planning Practice Guidance on
Conserving and enhancing the historic environment, and Tookes Green
Conservation Area Appraisal and Management Strategy.</span><br></p>
description: Single and two storey side extension; single storey rear extension; alterations to roof; external alterations (Demolition of attached garage)
